data.title: Cannot create new project, Godot crashes
data.body:
Windows 10 64 bits, master

I created a project fine with this build, but after that, any project I tried to create since have failed into a crash. I'm unsure wether it's reproducible for someone else yet, but for me it's stuck on repro 100%.

basically:

1) Launch Godot with debugger attached (MSVC for me), with no working dir and no options:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29588357-7687c274-8791-11e7-8794-ff2225da963e.png)

2) Choose "Create project", give it a new folder somewhere (on my end, it starts in C:/ drive, I changed it to D:/ and chose some folder to create the project in)
3) Validate, the project manager closes (and the debugger detaches so can't debug passed this point :( )
4) Godot crashes in the middle of splash screen.

Trying to open the project later on works fine.

Full log of the steps:

```
Activated GL 3.3 contextOpenGL ES 3.0 Renderer: GeForce 940M/PCIe/SSE2
GLES3: max ubo light: 409
GLES3: max ubo reflections: 455, ubo size: 144
ERROR: ClassDB::bind_methodfi: Couldn't bind method 'set_expand_margin_all' for instance: StyleBoxFlat
   At: core\class_db.cpp:1182
ERROR: ClassDB::bind_methodfi: Method/Function Failed, returning: 0
   At: core\class_db.cpp:1184
ERROR: ClassDB::bind_methodfi: Couldn't bind method 'set_expand_margin_individual' for instance: StyleBoxFlat
   At: core\class_db.cpp:1182
ERROR: ClassDB::bind_methodfi: Method/Function Failed, returning: 0
   At: core\class_db.cpp:1184
mode: spatial
1
SVG_GENERATION TIME: 0.251
vertex uses function: unpack_normal
fragment uses function: unpack_normal
OPENING: D:/PROJETS/INFO/GODOT/TESTS/3/lol/OpenGLErrors5 (D:::PROJETS::INFO::GODOT::TESTS::3::lol::OpenGLErrors5)
running cmdline: "D:\PROJETS\INFO\GODOT\ENGINE\godot_fork\bin\godot.windows.tools.64.exe" "--path" "D:/PROJETS/INFO/GODOT/TESTS/3/lol/OpenGLErrors5" "--editor"
Press <RETURN> to close this window...
Activated GL 3.3 contextOpenGL ES 3.0 Renderer: GeForce 940M/PCIe/SSE2
GLES3: max ubo light: 409
GLES3: max ubo reflections: 455, ubo size: 144
ERROR: ClassDB::bind_methodfi: Couldn't bind method 'set_expand_margin_all' for instance: StyleBoxFlat
```

data.title: Fixed issues with surround sound on audio server
data.body:
After this patch surround sound is working on: PulseAudio, OS X and WASAPI drivers.
Here's the really simple project I've used to test this:
[SurroundTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1243454/SurroundTest.zip)

data.title: Some UX notes about creating project folder
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits

I went through a bit of confusion while trying to create a project:

1) Open project manager
2) Create new project
3) Click "Browse" to pick a folder
4) On Windows, it opens by default in C:/Users/name, I want it to be in D:/something/uuhSomething/IDontRemember, so I try to click "/..", but it doesn't do anything, unlike any file explorer on Windows.
5) I decide to edit the path just to show the files in D:/ then:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29586530-3f8e1576-878b-11e7-9750-42b07a995b21.png)

At this point, the file list doesn't update, so I intuitively think that pressing "Enter" in the field would update the list...
Wrong! The dialog closes and the project ends up being created in D:/ while i didn't finish to find my folder.

Then I noticed that small drop down, which does what I wanted:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29586604-98f4063e-878b-11e7-991b-e7a9aa1707c8.png)

When I think about it, I understand the top URL textbox is the prompted directory and pressing enter will choose it, but for some reason I thought of it like a URL only used to show the file list below, like any other file explorer and browsers, and I thought the actual input field was the one at the bottom.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29586884-80a14c8a-878c-11e7-804e-d5170369b2f5.png)

That one is completely useless when looking for a folder.

Wouldn't it be more consistent if the top path was only "where you are" with no "Enter closes dialog", and the bottom path was the actual folder you want to choose/create?

data.title: [Feature Request] Double clicking on message in output should jump to file and line where message is printed
data.body:
In unity's output window it is possible to double click on every printed message to open the corresponding file and jump to the line with the print() method. 

I think something similar would be a nice addition to godot.

data.title: Fragment shader that uses TIME runs at 1 fps in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7, Godot 3 alpha 1, GTX 770, Driver version 378.49

**Issue description:**
This fragment shader creates vertical bands that scroll to the left:

```
shader_type canvas_item;
void fragment() {
	COLOR.rgb = vec3(sin(UV.x*10.0 + TIME));
}
```
When in game it runs at full speed and scrolls smoothly, but in the editor it looks like it only updates once per second.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a Sprite2D with any texture, and give it a ShaderMaterial with the shader code above.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[time_shader_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1242776/time_shader_bug.zip)

data.title: EditorHelp::_scroll_changed does not make sense
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot Master branch

**Issue description:**
I saw this `cppcheck` message:

```
[editor/editor_help.cpp:639]: (style) Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.
```

And the body of `EditorHelp::_scroll_changed` does not make sense to me at all.

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/294e912a843cde241f9abf619f5d40df9ef6ef9f/editor/editor_help.cpp#L633-L642

From what I can tell, it might as well be empty and does the same thing. Am I missing something?

data.title: Improve Mac/UNIX conformance/reliability
data.body:
### Commit 1:  _Make `OS::delay_usec()` more reliable on UNIX_

Implemented with `nanosleep()`. `usleep()` is deprecated.
Also loops to ensure that __at least__ the requested time is waited, accounting for spurious interruptions.

May help in situations like reattempting to connect to the debugger.

### Commit 2 __(UPDATED)__:  _Implement custom thread numbering for POSIX_

For every UNIX-derived (Android, Linux, macOS, iOS) flavor, a global counter is atomically incremented on thread start. That id is kept as thread-local storage.

Therefore, thread ids are sequential numbers, trivially comparable. This improves the previous state of things, in which `pthread_t` were casted to `Thread::ID` and unportabily compared. Also big, ugly thread ids appeared.

data.title: Fix OGV/Theora & Webm playback
data.body: I've done some looking into #10031. Replacing the Vorbis module with a stub like the Ogg module (since vorbis is now replaced with STB_Vorbis anyhow, this shouldn't be a huge loss) and writing a quick OGV/OGM ResourceLoader, I have video playback working without audio playback

data.title: [WIP] Add support for bidi text output
data.body:
This is a work in progress (**DON'T MERGE**).

Not optimized, require cleanup.

This PR uses portions of [ICU](http://site.icu-project.org/) and [HarfBuzz](https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/HarfBuzz/) libraries, to implement rendering of bi-direction text, complex scripts and OpenType typographic features.

### Current status:
![text_rendering_is_easy_and_fun](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7645683/30828802-7fac0a74-a247-11e7-8a3e-8b49e0814b5a.png)
Not implemented parts are grayed-out.

### Commit 1: ICU and HarfBuzz libraries

### Commit 2: `ParagraphLayout` class, `IntervalTree` class and underlying `dynamic_font` changes.

Functional, some features missing.

Takes string, font and other information, such as base text direction, language and script, preform bidi reordering, line breaking (whitespace<sup>1</sup> only, will not work for scripts with no separator character such as Thai, ICU have [UAX #14](http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr14/) implementation, but it is not currently integrated), context specific shaping and return `cluster`<sup>2</sup> lists in visual and logical order.

Each `cluster` contains original string character range, list of glyphs<sup>3</sup> with offsets, cluster visual position and size.

#### Usage:
```c++
        //Setup paragraph
        ParagraphLayout vt;
	vt.set_text(p_text, p_direction);
	vt.set_font(p_font);
	vt.set_lang(p_lang);            // optional: ISO 639 (*4) language code
        vt.set_max_width(p_width);      // optional: enable autowrap
	vt.set_ot_features(p_features); // optional: Comma-separated list of 4-letter typographic feature tags (*5/*6);

        //Analyse paragraph
        vt.analyse_paragraph();         // optional: will be automatically called on first draw if required

        //Draw paragraph
        for (int i = 0; i < vt.get_line_count(); i++) {
                const Vector<Ref<ClusterInfo> > &vo = vt.get_visual_order(i);
                for (int j = 0; j < vo.size(); j++) {
                        p_font->draw_cluster(canvas_item, Point2(x_ofs, y_ofs), vo[j], color);
                }
                y_ofs += line_spacing;
        }
```
<sup>1</sup> whitespace - Unicode separator characters, tabulation, form/line feed, carriage return, but not a non-breaking space.
<sup>2</sup> cluster - smallest indivisible linguistic unit.
<sup>3</sup> glyph - individual image/outline in a font.
<sup>4</sup> [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639)
<sup>5</sup> [OpenType typographic features](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_typographic_features#OpenType_typographic_features)
<sup>6</sup> [Feature format](https://github.com/behdad/harfbuzz/blob/03a5a6f873e5a50011f1c2418f5ceab86d9c2931/util/options.cc#L413)

### Commit 3: Modified `canvas_item`.

Adds `draw_bidi_string(font, pos, text, base_direction, features, script, lang, color);` to access `ParagraphLayout` in easy way.

![t1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7645683/30030550-8a18ccd4-9196-11e7-88e6-754ca6aee978.png)

#### Usage:
```
func _draw():
        draw_bidi_string(font, pos, text, base_direction, features, script, lang, color);
```
#### Demo project:
[BidiTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1274940/BidiTest.zip)

### Commits 4-5: Modified controls.

**Controls tracker:**
- [x] line_edit
- [x] label
- [ ] text_edit
- [ ] rich_text_label
- [ ] item_list

Mostly functional, but not fully tested.

#### Demo project:
[BidiEditTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1313874/BidiEditTest.zip)

### Related:
#3081, #9961, #982

data.title: remove core/ from include path
data.body:
core/ and core/math have been in the default include path, this can
cause trouble when a direction has files with the same basename as
files in core/ or core/math. (see #10071)

In order to fix such future problems all core/... includes need to
be explicit, preventing the compiler *not* including core files when
files with same basename are present.

data.title: [2.1] Change order of Null check for ParallaxLayer
data.body:
The change in #10524 subtly changes the behavior of set_motion_scale()
and set_motion_offset() if the ParallaxLayer does not have a parent
node. Previously it would still set the corresponding property, but
after this change the property change would be discarded.

I'm not entirely sure if this actually matters as there doesn't appear
to be any code that picks up this change if the ParallaxLayer gets
re-parented later, but it's better to not change behavior regardless.

data.title: Change order of Null check for ParallaxLayer
data.body:
The change in #10524 subtly changes the behavior of set_motion_scale()
and set_motion_offset() if the ParallaxLayer does not have a parent
node. Previously it would still set the corresponding property, but
after this change the property change would be discarded.

I'm not entirely sure if this actually matters as there doesn't appear
to be any code that picks up this change if the ParallaxLayer gets
re-parented later, but it's better to not change behavior regardless.

data.title: support enums and nested constants in match statement
data.body:
The initial version of the pattern matcher in GDScript does not
allow matching on nested identifiers, only one identifiers available
in the current scope.

With the introduction of enums to GDScript that's a huge missing
feature. This commit makes the parser accept indexed constants and
variables to properly support enums.

*Bugsquad edit:* Fixes #10571.

data.title: PanoramaSky without a texture triggers error
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version:**

Ubuntu 14.04, current master branch (01d4ffd)

**Issue description:**

PanoramaSky without a loaded panorama texture displays an error in the editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1) Create new: WorldEnvironment & Environment
2) Background Mode: Sky
3) Create new: PanoramaSky

Error is displayed in editor console until a Panorama texture is selected / loaded (tested with .png):

`drivers/gles3/rasterizer_scene_gles3.cpp:2331 - Condition ' !tex ' is true.`

Error is displayed again if the texture is cleared later on.

data.title: Strongly requested to cancel.Import
data.body:
The.Import 3.0 resource import is strongly requested to cause the editor to be very slow, and no global settings, and can not load external resources, greatly limiting the scalability of the engine

No global settings, resulting in many resources requiring manual settings

 Why do you want to import in advance? Some resources are only for reference, or why do you need to import the tests automatically? What the engine needs most is the excellent packaging tools to update the game version
